plants.name: Rhododendron ponticum
plants.description: An evergreen shrub known for its large clusters of bell-shaped flowers, typically found in woodland and mountainous regions. It thrives in temperate zones and is widely cultivated as an ornamental plant.
plants.location: Western Europe, especially the UK and Ireland
plants.funFact: Rhododendron ponticum is an invasive species in parts of the UK where it forms dense thickets that outcompete native plants.

plants.name: Lilium candidum
plants.description: A fragrant, tall perennial lily with large white trumpet-shaped flowers, symbolizing purity and often associated with religious iconography.
plants.funFact: Madonna Lily has been cultivated since ancient times and was highly valued in Greco-Roman culture.

plants.name: Telopea speciosissima
plants.description: An iconic Australian native shrub known for its bright red, dome-shaped flower clusters with striking stamens. It is the floral emblem of New South Wales.
plants.bloomingSeason: Spring (September to November) in Australia, corresponding to March-May in the Southern Hemisphere
plants.funFact: Waratahs regenerate following bushfires, as their seeds are adapted to heat and smoke to germinate.

plants.description: A hybrid deciduous tree famed for its large, tulip-shaped flowers that bloom profusely in spring before leaves emerge.
plants.location: Temperate regions worldwide, originally cultivated in France from Chinese species
plants.funFact: Saucer Magnolias bloom so early their flowers can tolerate frost, making them a spectacular spring sight.
